definitions.definition: To try to see, to pay attention to with one’s eyes.

definitions.example: It looks as if it’s going to rain soon.

definitions.definition: (copulative) To give an appearance of being.
(intransitive, often with "for") To search for, to try to find.
To face or present a view.
definitions.example: The hotel looks over the valleys of the HinduKush.
I look to each hour for my lover’s arrival.

definitions.definition: (transitive) To express or manifest by a look.
(transitive, often with "to") To make sure of, to see to.
(dated, sometimes figuratively) To show oneself in looking.
definitions.example: Look out of the window [i.e. lean out] while I speak to you.

definitions.definition: (transitive, obsolete) To look at; to turn the eyes toward.
(transitive, obsolete) To seek; to search for.
(transitive, obsolete) To influence, overawe, or subdue by looks or presence.
(baseball) To look at a pitch as a batter without swinging at it.
(intransitive) As an intransitive verb, often with "at".
(transitive, colloquial) As a transitive verb, often in the imperative; chiefly takes relative clause as direct object.
definitions.example: Look what you did to him!
Look, I'm going to explain what to do, so you have to listen closely.
